data.title: Token 1719 Marriage of Augustus III of Saxony with Maria
data.meta_description: Location: Southern Germany Type: Counter Token - Rechenpfennig Date: Undated, c.1719 Currency: Token - Rechenpfennig Grade: XF Composition: Brass Weight: 1.14
data.text:
Description

Location: Southern Germany

Type: Counter Token / Rechenpfennig

Date: Undated, c.1719

Currency: Token / Rechenpfennig

Grade: XF

Composition: Brass

Weight: 1.14 g

Diameter: 21 mm

Mint: Nuremberg

Shape: round (irregular)

Orientation: Coin alignment ↑↓

References: none

Obverse:

Crowned and armored bust of King Augustus III to right. Latin legend around.

Lettering:

AUG.III.D. - G. POL. REX.

Translation: Augustus III by the grace of God, King of Poland.

Reverse:

Crowned and armored bust of Queen Maria Josepha to left. Latin legend around. Below bust, the denomination and the initials of the engraver.

Lettering:

MARIA - JOSEPHA

I.I.D. R.P.

Translation: Maria Josepha - Iohann Iacob Dietzel - Rechenpfennig.

Engraver: Johann Jakob Dietzel (1711-1748).

Edge:

Smooth.

Comment:

Marriage (August 20, 1719) of Augustus III of Saxony, King of Poland, Grand Duke of Lithuania and Prince-Elector of Saxony, with Maria Josepha of Habsburg, Archduchess of Austria.

Son of Frederick August I of Saxony (Augustus II of Poland). 1719 married Maria Josepha, daughter of the emperor Joseph I. Succeeded his father as elector of Saxony in February 1733. Chosen king of Poland by a small minority of electors on in October 1733; crowned in Kraków on Jan. 17, 1734, and was generally recognized as king in Warsaw in June 1736.

Link: **************
